title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 December 2015 - XWiki
content:
<cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:18 <cjd> has quit  
07:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <cjd\_> has quit  
08:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <cjd> vmassol: do you know why woshilapin is not an Owner of the xwiki-contrib github namespace ?  
09:58 <vmassol> owners are only xwiki.org committers  
09:58 <vmassol> that's reason #1  
09:58 <vmassol> if woshilapin needs something he should ask :)  
09:58 <vmassol> also note that githib just changed the rules  
09:58 <vmassol> and owners no longer means owner  
09:59 <vmassol> (just learnt this now)  
09:59 <tmortagne> what changed is that owner is a role and not a team  
09:59 <tmortagne> but it still mean owner  
09:59 <vmassol> nope  
09:59 <cjd> oh, I think he did on the list  
09:59 <vmassol> github is even asking me to rename the group  
09:59 <vmassol> since it doesn't mean owner anymore  
10:00 <vmassol> "Owner is now a unique https://github.com/orgs/xwiki-contrib/people?query=role%3Aowner# given to individuals, which means the Owners team no longer gives special administrative privileges."  
10:00 <tmortagne> yes that's what I just said  
10:00 <tmortagne> it's a role  
10:00 <vmassol> "Owners team no longer gives special administrative privileges." this is the important part  
10:00 <vmassol> which means that owner is no longer an onwer  
10:00 <tmortagne> and all people that used to be in "owner" team have owner role  
10:00 <vmassol> "You should rename the team.  
10:00 <vmassol> Now that the Owners team no longer grants the owner role, renaming this team will help avoid any confusion.  
10:00 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <vmassol> "Try something like Employees or Core. Avoid misleading names like Admins."  
10:01 <vmassol> "If you’d like, you can also delete the team. However, some members may lose access to the repositories that the team currently grants."  
10:01 <tmortagne> so again there is still owners, you just don't set them trough a team but trough https://github.com/orgs/xwiki-contrib/people  
10:02 <vmassol> ,no you doidn't say that  
10:02 <vmassol> :)  
10:02 <vmassol> you said: "what changed is that owner is a role and not a team  
10:02 <tmortagne> yes this is a role  
10:02 <tmortagne> a user role  
10:02 <vmassol> it doesn't still mean owner  
10:03 <tmortagne> owner role have the same power as owner team used to have so yes there is still something called owner and it still mean the same thing  
10:03 <vmassol> again that's not what githib says as I have pasted it  
10:03 <vmassol> if you don't believe it that's your choice :)  
10:04 <vmassol> "Owners team no longer gives special administrative privileges."  
10:04 <vmassol> stopping the discussion here, it's not prodcutive  
10:04 <tmortagne> here is another thing github say: "Owner is now a role, not a team."  
10:04 <vmassol> what we need is to decide the new name we want for our existing "owner" team  
10:04 <tmortagne> word for word what I just said, you get it when you try to go to owner team  
10:04 <vmassol> or whether we want to drop it  
10:30 <vmassol> woshilapin: good morning, creating the repo  
10:30 <vmassol> and jira  
10:31 <woshilapin> Good morning  
10:31 <woshilapin> Thanks :-)  
10:42 <tmortagne> vmassol: would be great if you could look at XWIKI-12884  
10:42 <tmortagne> I'm on XWIKI-12878 right now  
10:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok I will (need to finish something first)  
10:45 <vmassol> I hope it's not caused by sergiu's recent changes :)  
11:06 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <Ramona1> has quit  
11:31 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: where does the new resource handler system initialize the XWikiContext ? looks like it does not set the current wiki properly (at least it does not take into account the domain). That's what causes http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12878  
11:37 <tmortagne> maybe it just does not initialize it at all ?  
11:37 <tmortagne> it does seems to initialize the ExecutionContext since the right Classloader is put in the Thread  
11:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes I don't think it initializes it ATM. It's left to the handler right now AFAIR. I didn't get the time (and didn't need it so far) to have it done globally for all handlers. This would be an improvement probably.  
11:50 <tmortagne> it's not so much about XWikiContext for itself but more the fact that without XWikiContext you don't know the current wiki which is important to load the right components, classes  
11:50 <tmortagne> which is happening here  
11:51 <vmassol> ok  
11:52 <tmortagne> I'm pretty sure most resource handlers should know the current wiki to behave correctly, without talking about resource handlers that load stuff from the database  
11:53 <vmassol> I agree  
12:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <Ramona3> has quit  
12:37 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <Ramona3> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <sorinello> has quit  
14:15 <Ramona3> has quit  
14:15 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <sorinello> has quit  
14:35 <mflorea> tmortagne: there's a compiler error in InfinispanConfigurationLoader.java on the stable-6.4.x branch, in case you didn't see it  
14:35 <tmortagne> mflorea: indeed I did not see, checking  
14:35 <tmortagne> thanks  
14:41 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <msmeria> has quit  
15:13 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <Trefex> hi all. does anybody know if it's possible to change the display name of a wiki?  
15:14 <vmassol> Trefex: yes, you can edit that wiki's descriptor  
15:14 <Trefex> doh  
15:14 <Trefex> ..  
15:14 <Trefex> vmassol: thanks :)  
15:20 <Trefex-1> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <Trefex-1> has quit  
15:23 <fca> has quit  
15:24 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:26 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <Trefex> another silly question really, i understand the [[]] syntax for making links  
15:30 <Trefex> but somehow it doesn't work to link to other sub-wikis  
15:31 <Trefex> i tried [[wikiname:WebHome]] and variations of that  
15:32 <cjd> [[wiki:Main.WebHome]]  
15:32 <cjd> should do it  
15:33 <Trefex> ah damn thanks cjd  
15:33 <Trefex> so close :D  
15:37 <tmortagne> yes you forgot the Space part  
15:37 <cjd> [[wiki:Main. WebHome]]  
15:38 <cjd> there, a space :)  
15:38 \* Trefex thinks he's weird...  
15:39 <Trefex> by the way, since you're both here, I am running 7.1.2 very nicely  
15:39 <cjd> surprise? fear? many reasons why we find things funny :)  
15:39 <Trefex> and am sort of scared to upgrade  
15:39 <tmortagne> upgrade to 7.3 you mean ?  
15:39 <Trefex> to whatever is stable now  
15:39 <cjd> maybe that's it, giggling out of fear and it's fear of the upgrade :)  
15:42 <tmortagne> depends what you mean by stable, 7.2 introduce a big change in the UI with the new nested spaces/pages but so far 7.3 seems ok in term of known regression compared to 7.1.x except for the 2 issue listed in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki73  
15:42 <Trefex> so no major issues with LDAP and so on?  
15:42 <Trefex> i saw some stuff on Jira  
15:44 <Trefex> so what would an upgrade path look like? Put maintenance to 1 in xwiki.cfg, do a backup, then update, then update each sub wiki individually?  
15:46 <tmortagne> not sure what maintenance property you are talking about  
15:47 <tmortagne> first thing is making sure you can put back easily you previous 7.1.x state  
15:47 <Trefex> store.migration or whatever  
15:47 <Trefex> for that i can snapshot the VM i suppose  
15:47 <tmortagne> I guess that should do it  
15:47 <Trefex> oh, perhaps i could clone the snapshot and try on the clone...  
15:48 <tmortagne> that's what we do for xwiki.org  
15:48 <tmortagne> upgrade the clone and when all is ok switch IP  
15:48 <Trefex> ah mhhh  
15:48 <Trefex> i rather carry out upgrade procedure on the main no?  
15:48 <tmortagne> that means putting the other one as readonly  
15:49 <Trefex> why?  
15:49 <tmortagne> so that you don't loose modification done in the previous one while you are upgrading  
15:49 <tmortagne> otherwise anything done by user during the upgrade will be lost  
15:50 <Trefex> no i mean if i upgrade the main  
15:50 <Trefex> i don't have to care about that right?  
15:50 <Trefex> i mean i upgrade clone and main  
15:50 <Trefex> in that order  
15:50 <tmortagne> sure but it all depends if access is critical for you or if you can just say "maintenance today, don't come"  
15:52 <Trefex> yeah, oh because if somebody else access the website, it could screw up the upgrade process you mean?  
15:52 <tmortagne> I don't think so but they will see things moving, might have some issue with wiki half upgraded, things like this  
15:52 <Trefex> is it actually possible to put the wiki in "maintenance" mode?  
15:53 <tmortagne> depends what you mean by maintenance  
15:53 <tmortagne> there is a readonly mode  
15:53 <tmortagne> or you put some message in your apache saying that maintenance is running  
15:53 <tmortagne> so that nobody access the wiki except you  
16:20 <mflorea> has quit  
16:32 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
16:37 <mouhb> has joined #xwiki  
16:45 <vmassol> creating repo for mohamed  
16:46 <mouhb> Thank you vincent  
16:48 <Trefex> i think upgrade worked  
16:48 <Trefex> UI is completely different :D  
16:48 <vmassol> I hope you like it :)  
16:48 <vmassol> feedback welcome on the list !  
16:49 <Trefex> well first off i can already tell that I don't like that I can't see if i'm logged in or not  
16:49 <Trefex> and if yes, as which user  
16:50 <vmassol> mouhb: done, see mail  
16:51 <vmassol> what version Trefex?  
16:51 <Trefex> vmassol: can you see the warnings i get in catalina since the upgrade?  
16:51 <Trefex> https://paste.fedoraproject.org/298213/95034381/  
16:51 <Trefex> vmassol: well 7.3  
16:51 <vmassol> you can see your avatar  
16:51 <Trefex> yeah ok, i meant at least a "Log In" menu could be on the top  
16:52 <Trefex> my users will call me searching for the "Log In" menu :)  
16:52 <vmassol> it's at the top  
16:52 <vmassol> in the drawer menu where all top level actions are located now  
16:52 <Trefex> yes in the drawer menu  
16:52 <Trefex> which is not intuitive  
16:52 <vmassol> ok would be great if you could play a bit with it and send us some email on the list with feedback  
16:53 <vmassol> (no need to hurry, take your time to use it ;))  
16:53 <vmassol> because here any message is going to be lost  
16:53 <vmassol> ;)  
16:53 <Trefex> lol well  
16:53 <Trefex> true  
16:54 <Trefex> vmassol: did you see the pastie i sent?  
16:57 <Trefex> mhh, now my xwiki is not starting anymore  
16:58 <vmassol> Trefex: sorry busy  
17:01 <Trefex> vmassol: no worries, i guess i have to revert back to 7.1.2, the wiki is not starting at all  
17:14 <sorinello> has quit  
17:21 <ClemensR> Trefex: what kind of installation is that? It looks like some default config path has been overwritten  
17:22 <Trefex> ClemensR: the pastie you mean? that is 7.3  
17:22 <ClemensR> no, er, yes, I mean the general installation info ... obviously a tomcat, but is it a debian package, or manual install, etc ...  
17:24 <ClemensR> it looks more liek a tomcat problem to me. if tomcat cannot find its pasic libraries it will not start. This should have nothing to do with XWiki, normally ...  
17:27 <Trefex> ClemensR: debian  
17:28 <ClemensR> about the login/logout link: custom can add a new entry to rhe extension point "org.xwiki.platform.topmenu.right" , see  http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki73#HFlamingo-1  
17:28 <Trefex> debain package  
17:28 <ClemensR> ah, ok, then then just restarted with /etc/init.d/tomcat7 restart ?  
17:30 <vmassol> has quit  
17:30 <Trefex> ye  
17:33 <ClemensR> in the /etc/init.d/tomcat7  there should be an CATALINA\_BASE=/var/lib/$NAME  - it looks like the sever is missing that line  
17:33 <ClemensR> and behaves like CATALINA\_BASE=/usr/share/$NAME  
17:33 <ClemensR> in that case it does not fin the "xwiki" webapp, and thus XWiki will not start, as it is not even been asked to do so  
17:34 <tmortagne> mouhb: you indicate that xwikitube depends on video macro but I don't see this dependency in https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-xwikitube/blob/master/pom.xml  
17:35 <mouhb> It is not depends for the moment I will update the README file  
17:35 <tmortagne> ok  
17:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:40 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <mouhb3> has joined #xwiki  
17:48 <mouhb> has quit  
17:49 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
18:01 <Trefex> where is the permanent data path defined?  
18:01 <Trefex> i need to apparently delete the solr folder  
18:02 <Trefex> is the one in /var/lib/xwiki/data ?  
18:02 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:04 <tmortagne> Trefex: yes, it's defined in /etc/xwiki/xwiki.properties  
18:04 <Trefex> tmortagne: thanks !  
18:04 <cjd> has quit  
18:12 <Trefex> by the way, i think it was also failing because i didn't clear my solr index  
18:12 <Trefex> since i did not read the 7.2 at all (skipped that version)  
18:13 <tmortagne> Trefex: well it's hard to know where to stop in copy past of old migration sections  
18:13 <Trefex> mhhh well  
18:14 <Trefex> also true  
18:15 <Trefex> and last question for today i promise, what happens if the internet goes away during upgrade process?  
18:15 <Trefex> does it timeout, retry, or fail and explode?  
18:15 <tmortagne> the first thing it does is downloading everything  
18:16 <tmortagne> so it won't break in the middle of the pages upgrade  
18:16 <Trefex> if that process gets stuck, what to do ?  
18:17 <Trefex> it's not stuck at Downloading extension whatever  
18:17 <tmortagne> depends what internet you are talking about actually  
18:17 <Trefex> since 5 minutes  
18:17 <tmortagne> if it's between you and your wiki or the wiki and internet  
18:17 <Trefex> the uni has some shitty firewalls and routers, and we regularly have stalled downloads using wget, curl or whatever  
18:17 <Trefex> in the range of 80-85%  
18:18 <Trefex> which just happened to me, so was wondering how to resume  
18:18 <tmortagne> the upgrade process is running on server side and what you see is just a refresh of the current state  
18:18 <Trefex> yep  
18:18 <Trefex> server side curl / wget get stalled all the time  
18:19 <Trefex> been fighting with networkign people since 2 years, who claim there's no issue with them  
18:19 <Trefex> but that there's bug in wget...  
18:19 <tmortagne> so loosing internet won't change much for the upgrade process ecept that sometime you will have to get back your connection to unlock the upgrade asking you for some conflict or nest step  
18:19 <tmortagne> s/nest/next/  
18:19 <Trefex> yep, that is nice, but what to do when the server is stuck because the server downloads got stalled?  
18:20 <Trefex> should i just restart tomcat?  
18:20 <tmortagne> not sure what you mean, if XWiki cannot download what it need to will see an error  
18:20 <tmortagne> and you can retry  
18:20 <tmortagne> there is no reason it get stuck because of that  
18:20 <Trefex> ok, right now, since 10 minutes, the upgrader is stuck at "Downloading extension ...."  
18:20 <tmortagne> there is a timeout on XWiki side  
18:21 <tmortagne> what you see is the last status you were able to get but if you have issue between you and your wiki then you see an old status  
18:22 <Trefex> that connection is fine  
18:22 <Trefex> well if there's a timeout, i guess i have to wait  
18:23 <tmortagne> AFAIK the download timeout is a lot less than 10 minutes so not sure what can be your issue  
18:23 <tmortagne> in any case as I said before if it's really stuck in a download it did not started upgrade anything  
18:23 <Trefex> i'll rstart tomcat and see what happens  
18:23 <tmortagne> so killing it should not break anything  
18:25 <Trefex> ok seems to be working now  
18:26 <Trefex> tmortagne: where's your beer tap ?  
18:26 <Trefex> i wanna donate :D  
18:27 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:30 <Trefex> getting these kind of warnings now in log file  
18:30 <Trefex> WARN  .o.i.DefaultObservationManager - The [org.xwiki.localization.wiki.internal.ComponentDocumentTranslationBundle] listener is overwritting a previously registered listener [org.xwiki.localization.wiki.internal.ComponentDocumentTranslationBundle] since they both are registered under the same id [localization.bundle.document:lcsbics:Panels.Translations]. In the future consider removing a Listener first if you really want to register it again.
